news_header: 90 false killer whales euthanised after mass stranding in Tasmania.
news_original_title: Scores of whales to be euthanised after mass stranding in Australia
news_text: Australian authorities are euthanising about 90 false killer whales that survived a mass stranding on a remote beach in Tasmania. Experts deemed it impossible to save them due to complex conditions. The pod of 157 whales stranded near Arthur River, with the rest dying shortly after. Euthanasia was considered a last resort after unsuccessful rescue attempts.
